issues.description: Visibility mismatch for Animal's constructor and name accessors: the problem statement (UML and explicit note) indicates the Animal constructor and the getName()/setName() methods should have protected visibility (UML uses '#', and Part 1 explicitly asks for protected getter/setter). The solution implementation declares the constructor and both accessor methods as public. This deviates from the specified encapsulation and may confuse students about the intended visibility (and cause tests that check for protected visibility to fail).
issues.suggested_fix: Make the Animal constructor and the getName()/setName() accessors protected to match the UML and the explicit instruction in the problem statement (or, if the intent was to allow public access, update the problem statement/UML to state public visibility). Concretely, change the solution's Animal.java declarations from public Animal(String name), public String getName(), and public void setName(String) to protected Animal(String name), protected String getName(), and protected void setName(String).
